subject: Travel
title: Gunpowder Goes West
description: A quick win: understand Gunpowder Goes West.

hook.text: Chinese alchemists were searching for an immortality potion. They invented gunpowder instead.

buildup.text: For centuries, China used gunpowder mainly for fireworks and signal rockets, not weapons.

discovery.text: Mongol conquests in the 1200s carried gunpowder technology westward along the Silk Road.

twist.text: Europeans turned it into cannons and guns, weapons far deadlier than China had ever built.

climax.text: Gunpowder ended the age of castles and knights. Warfare changed forever within a century.

punchline.text: A search for eternal life created history's deadliest weapon.

quiz.question: What were Chinese alchemists originally trying to create when they invented gunpowder?
